Reviews.Title: Touch-screen, Easily Upgradeable, Looks Good, Feels Solid
Reviews.Author: YSC
Reviews.Content: Likes:- The black textured plastic finish is very nice, and is used as top-side panels (top cover, palm rest). I like this better than the two-tone metallic finish since it looks more integrated, more business-like, and less as a "tack-on" like the metallic sheet accents in the 15RM. It also means the side and bottom plastic isn't a silver painted variety, but a hard ABS plastic that when scratched, will stay the same color and harder to detect. In my opinion, it is more practical and unpretentious, and the textured finish makes it no less aesthetically appealing--and in my opinion more so--than the metallic trim edition.- Windows 8 is apparently a very touch-centric OS. I suspect that may have caused some initial complaints and awkwardness with mouse and keyboard users (myself included). Having a touch screen really alters the experience. It's really more like a tablet with a keyboard than a PC with touch screen. In that sense, it is also more intuitive for users who are not tech-savvy or uncomfortable with computers. With a fairly large and vibrant glass touch screen, this laptop offers the full Windows 8 experience. I know this is a controversial issue, but while I still miss the start button, I grew to like the user experience, as did my family--especially my parents who were really uncomfortable of PCs in the past.- The overall build quality feels solid, with hard ABS plastic tub as the main chassis that's fairly durable. The touchpad is very responsive, and the keyboard has a good tactile feel. The glass touch screen apparently have enhanced the lid's rigidity as well, reducing flex which can often be an issue with large screen plastic shell laptops.- The i3 may seem like a low end processor, but to my understanding the i5 offers in addition "turbo" mode and virtualization. The former offers a small gain (a few hundred MHz in the lower end models) in clock speed for single thread applications (such as encoding), which isn't terribly common in daily tasks that are often multithreaded. The virtualization is used for Virtual Machines, XP Mode, VMWare, etc., which I suspect is probably not terribly useful for most of us. In that sense it's really the best bang for the buck, and it excelled at daily tasks like browsing, movies, Office, and the like. It handled everything we threw at it very smoothly.- The battery on this machine actually lasts longer than I expected for this screen size. With around medium usage like playing music and video, I was able to get 3-4 hours. If I try to use it mostly to encode a video or do some 3D gaming, I could still get 2-3 hours. It would last longer, such as 4-5 hours, if you were just doing light tasks like office or browsing.- The onboard Intel 4000 integrated graphics isn't the fastest or the most powerful, but other than 3D gaming, it really handles everything else with aplomb. It plays full HD videos without any issues, and the HDMI out can also let you connect to a larger monitor and TV with even higher resolution than the laptop monitor. It worked with my 27" 2560x1440 monitor just fine. Connect a bluetooth/usb keyboard and mouse, it can be an affordable and versatile energy efficient desktop as well.- It's easily upgradeable. This cannot be overemphasized especially seeing how the "ultrabook" concept often eschew upgradable ease for aesthetics. Both the hard drive and the two SO-DIMM memory slots are easily accessible through the bottom hatch cover with a few screws. It can house two SO-DIMM chips so the maximum capacity would be 16GB of RAM (it comes installed in both slots with 2GB each). The SATA drive can also be replaced with a SSD drive easily as well.- Good Connectivity- comes with bluetooth built in, something that can be appreciated when there are more bluetooth enabled portable devices/peripherals than ever: mice, keyboards, speakers, etc. 4 USB Ports (2 of which are USB 3.0) and HDMI makes for very updated connectivity. The built in multi-card reader as well as DVD burner drive also wouldn't hurt.Some Potential Issues:- The aforementioned black textured top cover (on the back of the top lid and palm rest), while looking more expensive than it is, still manages to pick up and show oil mark from palm where it is handled. Similar issue with the touchpad and palm rest area. The black just shows oily smudges and lint/dust a bit easier. However, that largely depends on how it is used. A little cleaning easily takes care of that.- It's not the most portable computer at over 5 pounds. With a 15.6" screen, you probably shouldn't expect it to be. This is probably more suitable for infrequent relocation where you get a larger screen and full size keyboard as a trade-off.- The screen resolution is only 1366x768 (good enough for 720p), with no optional upgrades apparently. In the era of ultra high resolution displays (e.g. Retina), that's probably going to be a gripe for some. People would probably expect at least a full HD (e.g. 1920x1080) display, especially given the large 15"+ screen size. However, given the price point and touch screen, the resolution isn't unreasonable. It is suitable enough for most daily tasks, and the lower resolution density makes for larger text and pictures for much easier viewing (particularly for seniors). There is always the option of connecting to an external monitor via HDMI, as mentioned above.- The Intel HD4000 integrated graphics isn't good for 3D gaming, so you probably shouldn't look at this if you plan on playing 3D games with it, unless you can stand lowest rendering settings with low framerates. 2D games, however, are very smooth and easily managed.- The included 500GB hard drive is a typical 2.5" 5400RPM drive. Like its storage capacity, it's adequate, and hasn't presented me with any issues with performance or responsiveness. One should probably not expect better at this price point. It may feel slow to some (especially if you are used to desktops with 7200RPM drives or even SSDs), yet it does have the advantage of reduced heat and power consumption over 7200RPM hard drives. If speed is really a priority, SSD is the way to go (at a premium), and can be easily upgraded.- No D-Sub VGA port. It should probably be phased out in modern laptops anyway. This may be an issue only if you use legacy products with only VGA support, such as older presentation projectors. However, a HDMI to VGA adapter is inexpensive and easily solves that.Notes:Dell has been a solid choice for budget laptops for years. I personally think this is a great iteration that doesn't feel cheap, but looks professional and almost expensive. The touch screen really completes the included Windows 8, and makes for an intuitive user experience that may be worth your giving it the benefit of the doubt. This is not meant to be a high end laptop, so if you tend to have CPU or graphic intensive tasks (e.g. video rendering, 3D Modeling, 3D gaming, etc.), or want something ultra-portable, you should probably look to pay more for something else. (In my opinion, if you really need ultra-portability, tablet/smartphones is probably the way to go). Yet if you don't carry around your laptop often, or just want something more efficient and smaller than desktop PC, without sacrificing too much power and comfort: this Inspiron offers easy upgradability, vibrant touch-screen, decent battery life, solid construction, and good performance. If you don't mind the bulk, this is a very affordable, functional and solid laptop that will easily satisfy.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Everyday Computing
Reviews.Author: EuReka
Reviews.Content: This laptop really packs a punch! It will do all of the web surfing, email, itunes, music, etc that you can throw at it! I've even done a little low end gaming and a little video editing on it and it even works smoothly for that! I'm gonna try to touch a little on each aspect of the laptop and how it has performed to me so far..WebcamPretty Solid, It appears to be better than the iPhone cameras and my old laptop one, or so say my callers :PHard DriveNice and speedy, is not a 7200rpm though but I'm sure people don't move copious amounts of data on their laptops though.DVD BurnerNo blanks, burns fast and isn't as annoyingly loud as my previous laptops drive.Media Card ReaderA great feature to have, It works and no more draining my cameras battery life in order to get pics off of it!ProcessorIs a new Core i3 dual core and this beats my old laptops core2duo hands down. Much snappier, never lags and even works great to render some small videos, I was surprised how well it performs compared to my farm more expensive Core i7 in my gaming rig I just built.RAM4GB? That's more than you will ever need in an "Everday Lappy"Windows 8I was so worried about trying Win8 - The new start menu and everything seemed like such a turn off but it's actualy fairly pleasant because you have a touchscreen so it really does feel more natural. Just like Win7 - Win8 is smooth and very efficient unlike that "Vista" mishap *cough*TouchscreenThe screen is very bright, crisp and clear. Give it a nice wipe down with a microfiber at the end of each day in order to prevent smudging and fingerprinting. It's very responsive and it smooth to the touch as well. Something I never thought we would see in this price range for awhile!Audio/SpeakersIt's okay, again it is a laptop so don't expect excellent quality bass and everything with the built in speakers. For everyday use and some light gaming it is more than adequate though.Battery LifeLaptop seems to be energy efficient, I am getting at least 5-6 hours with surfing use on a single charge. Charging time is pretty snappy as well.TouchpadSmooth but a light textured feel to it so there is no "skidding" of your fingers when you are trying to scroll fast, Responsive.BluetoothI do not own any bluetooth devices but this should be handy for those of you who like the wireless headphones or have that wireless data cards.WirelessThis thing gets some pretty strong signal range. Our router is kept up in the attic and I get full signal anywhere in the house, and even out to the edge of our property in both the front and back yards. It's been nice sitting in the shade outside as summer winds down and be on skype calls or the like outside.Build QualityWeighs in at around 5 pounds, Have a nice solid feel to it although it is made with a plastic shell. The screen has a little flex to it, It's fairly thin but it shouldnt be a problem unless you really "try" to flex it. I would imagine that it would survive many falls from your lap onto the floor though. The outside texture/design is pretty cool too. Nothing fancy, but it's better than just a smooth and plain texture.GraphicsThe build in Intel graphics look pretty sweet. Playing some of my DVD and Bluray collection on the laptop looks amazing. It can even be used as a "player" when hooked up to your HD tvs via the HDMI connection. This plays my favorite games at around medium settings with shadows turned off (shadows are the hardest on the graphics processors to process) and it has performed well even after hours of playing.Software/BloatwareJust say no, Make it a habit to remove all of the factory included software. :]

Reviews.Title: Nicely done
Reviews.Author: Dr. XYZ
Reviews.Content: Being a Windows 8 hater really forced me to carefully choose a laptop for a friend as Win7 laptops are sparse and usually only the over priced models are available.With that said, this laptop has a touch screen, which is pretty much required to make the best use of Win8,  it has the ivy bridge processor which is best for power management. Some laptops in this price range don't have DVD/CD players in them but this one does.It worked perfectly out of the box, is fast, and allows Win8 to achieve its greatest potential.

Reviews.Title: Adequate
Reviews.Author: Allen C.
Reviews.Content: I've had Dells for about 10 years including a 17" Studio that I really like. This 15" Inspiron is an updated replacement. Since I've used Apple products since the mid-80's, as well, the Windows 8 OS didn't really give me much trouble, although I still use my Windows 7 desktop configuration for most things.  As far as I can tell the touchscreen function is mostly fluff but it's handy some of the time.Things I like:  It's light weight but still has a large touch screen, the battery life is pretty good, it doesn't get hot, and I can still run my old photo processing program from earlier Dells.Things I don't like: The Windows 8 search function for the computer is not as useful as the old one- it really doesn't let you search the entire computer. The left click key on the touchpad is extremely noisy and doesn't have the same feel as the other keys. Often, if the cursor gets near- not on- the right side of the screen the touch menu pops out and keeps coming back as you repeatedly dismiss it until the cursor is safely moved away.  Its a hassle and a distraction.Other than the above, the Inspiron works well enough on its own but whenever Microsoft, Firefox or Thunderbird has an update it suddenly starts behaving erratically- freezing up, grinding slowly at loading, sometimes the cursor disappears altogether and the touchscreen doesn't respond. My email system will go belly up.  A lot of this is Windows 8, no doubt, but it's part of this laptop so Dell gets some of the blame for it, too.In the end this is an adequate, inexpensive laptop that does everything I need but it also has some aggravating quirks that my 5 year old Studio 17 did not suffer from.

Reviews.Title: Best touchscreen Laptop under 500!!!
Reviews.Author: Chad
Reviews.Content: If you are like me and you research a product so much that it annoys your wife then I have done all the hard work for you. I started out wanting a laptop under 400. Don't waste your time there isn't much there. I wasn't sure if I needed a touchscreen. If you are running windows 8 that is a definite yes despite what the best buy guy told me. There are multiple Dell laptops out there, some touch screen and some not. What's the difference besides price?This laptop is practically the same except it's a Pentium processor. Don't get it. It's a good processor but the i3 is much faster and more energy efficient which equals better battery life. Dell Inspiron 15 i15RVT-3762BLK 15.6-Inch Touchscreen Laptop (Black)This laptop is also almost the same with a Pentium processor. Don't get it. Would you rather have a "new" 1989 Honda accord or a "new" 2013 Honda accord? Similar processors with i3 being more efficient. Dell Inspiron 15 (3521) i15RV-6143BLK 15.6-Inch Touchscreen Laptop (Black Matte with Textured Finish)Like I said before, just get the touch screen. It incorporates really well with everything. With the swipe of a finger you can switch from Microsoft word over to internet which was great when writing my metallurgy paper this morning. Also, the keyboard is really nice which looked a bit strange to me in the pictures. The keyboard is spill resistant and the number key on the side is really handy. The optical drive will burn a cd to your computer very quickly. The battery is great, I unplugged at 8am this morning and with the screen on bright using internet by Wi-Fi and writing a paper all day I plugged back in at 1pm with it showing 17% left which it showed as 1 hour remaining. The speakers are good, they do not distort at high levels. The screen really doesn't show fingerprints excessively as I have been touching it multiple times and have yet to see any streaks. The touch screen is very responsive, accurate, and easy to use. I am coming from a 2006 Gateway laptop which died finally. So I would recommend this dell without actually favoring dell in the first place. there was another laptop just like this one for $50 more that had a smooth metal looking finish but I would skip out on the extra charge as this one is actually very nice. It does not take long to boot up, but if it is sleeping it will boot in less than 2 seconds which is pretty cool. It comes with an hdmi, two 2.0 usb, two 3.0 usb, a multi card reader, and an optical drive which is awesome. Keep an eye on Asus if researching those. Most do not have optical drives. This computer is light and does not throw much heat. Am I missing anything? I love it definitely recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Love this Laptop!  High Quality and Easy to Use...
Reviews.Author: ThisThatNEverything "thisthatneverything"
Reviews.Content: My Laptop & Windows History:Prior to getting this laptop I'd been using my previous one for about 4 years.  It was an ASUS and had Windows 7 on it.  I liked that one but it was getting old and outdated, full and slow.  It was time for a new one.  Earlier this year I purchased a Samsung laptop that came with Windows 8.  The laptop was horrible.  It was slow and cheaply made.  I ended up returning it after just a few days.  Since this was my first experience with Windows 8 it left a bad impression in my head.  I thought my problem with that laptop had something to do with that.  When we returned that laptop we told Customer Service that it was like taking a laptop from 10 years ago and slapping a new title on it and installing Windows 8 on it.  It was really primitive.This Laptop with Windows 8:I was a bit nervous getting this Dell laptop since it comes with Windows 8 but that's pretty much all you can find on the market today.  Turns out that I was nervous for nothing.  This laptop rocks!  Although I'm not a huge fan of Windows 8, it's certainly not as bad as I thought it was.  It's easy to maneuver around it.Size and Keyboard Layout:Bigger is not always better in my findings with laptops.  I do a ton of typing so the keyboard layout is very important to me.  I find the layout on the 15.6" laptop very comfortable and spaced out just right.  It's not too compact making it difficult to type and it's not too spaced out that you have to reach a bit more than you'd like.  They number pad and the arrows are really great on this laptop.  On my ASUS laptop I hit the wrong button often and my wrist was a little uncomfortable when using the number pad.  The layout on this laptop is just perfect for me in every way.Other thoughts:Speed- I think this laptop is very fast.  And I love how you can boot it up and you're good to go in less than a minute.Picture Quality- The picture looks great on this laptop.  With that Samsung laptop that I had, the picture quality was awful.  I have absolutely no complaints about the graphic quality on this laptop.  It's very high quality.Touch Screen- I've never used a Touch Screen laptop before so I wasn't sure how good it would be.  What a great feature.  It works really well and always does what I'm telling it to do.  I haven't had any issues with it and although I thought I'd have fingerprints or smudges all over the screen I don't.  I love this feature.Space- 500GB is the minimum that I wanted in a laptop so this is a great size for me.  Really good for the price.CD / DVD Drive- A CD Drive is not an option for me, it must have one.  There are so many laptops out there nowadays that no longer have this feature.  I was very happy to see that this laptop has it.  It works great too.  On my previous laptop I was constantly accidentally opening the CD Drive.  This isn't a problem on this laptop.  It stays closed.  You have to push a small little button in just the right way to get this one to pop open.  This is a plus for me.Textured Finish- Although I like the feel of the textured finish on this laptop, it leaves way too many fingerprints.  It's difficult to clean them off too.  When the laptop is just lying there closed it doesn't look too great because it always looks like there are greasy fingerprints all over it.  Our hands are always clean when we use the laptop so it's just the oils from your skin that leaves marks.  This would probably be the only thing that I would complain about with this laptop.Solidness- When I had the Samsung laptop for a few days I noticed that it felt empty.  It just felt like an empty plastic shell.  This laptop feels solid and it's not a cheap plastic feel.  This laptop feels how a laptop should feel.Getting started- Right out of the box I found this laptop to be fast and easy to set-up.  I had it up and running in probably 5-10 minutes.  It's a very simple set-up process.Overall I absolutely love this laptop and I would highly recommend it.  It's a great everyday laptop that I find to be very high quality.

Reviews.Title: Great everyday laptop for the money
Reviews.Author: Chicago Book Addict
Reviews.Content: My Apple laptop is on its last legs so I got this as a replacement.  Overall, it doesn't have some of the bells and whistles of the Apple (which is to be expected based on the substantial price difference), but is a solid laptop for someone on a budget and functionally, is sufficient for most of what the average user will need a laptop for.Aesthetics:Overall I liked the black and thought the textured finish was an interesting touch.  It does give the laptop a distinctive look.  The plastic case also seems sturdy and like it will be able to stand up to wear and tear.  However, it doesn't necessarily have a luxurious look to it like you get with an Apple.  Personally, I prefer the look of the metal on the MacBook Pros although it can get easily dented. (Again, however, this is a tradeoff based on the price, and was something I expected.)Performance:Overall, I have found the speed of this computer to be good.  It doesn't generally get hung up, even when I have multiple programs open, which is a plus.  It also works well when gaming.  I've been playing The Sims 3 with expansion packs on this and haven't had any issues with the game crashing or lagging.  The only thing I have noticed is that from time to time, the mouse seems to get hung up even when the keyboard is responsive.  I haven't quite figured out what causes this, but thankfully it only seems to happen from time to time.Functionality:Overall I find the functionality of the computer to be good.  The Windows interface is taking some getting used to since I have almost exclusively been a Mac user for a few years.  I'm not sure everything is laid out in the most intuitive manner, but do enjoy the home screen.  However, after playing around with it for a couple weeks it does become increasingly easier to get the hang of.  (Especially when I played around with the mouse settings since some of the side swiping motions were tripping me up.)  I still prefer the Mac interface over this, but haven't found it to be prohibitively difficult to use.  My only real nit is that I have less say when it updates the Windows 8 software than I felt I did on a Mac.  Here it does give you some warning the update is coming but when it updates there seems to be no way to delay it from happening at the exact moment the computer deems it necessary.  Unfortunately this has been at times when I needed the computer at that exact moment and the updates seemed to be a few minutes long so it was quite annoying.It is important to note that this computer doesn't come with much of any preloaded software so unless you will use this only for web browsing you'll need to plan to purchase other software and should factor that cost in on top of the purchase price of the laptop.  There is some basic photo editing software, a trial version of Office (which you will have to pay for at the end of the trial), and a IE browser.  Thankfully, if price is an issue there are increasingly a lot of great freeware programs available on the internet that offer similar functionality to more expensive programs like office or Photoshop.I also love that this computer makes it easy to connect to other devices.  The # of USB ports has been sufficient for my use and I love that there is already a built in media card reader.  It makes it very convenient when I want to upload pictures to my computer.Overall, I think this laptop is a great value for the money and good for everyday computing needs.  I've been happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great Budget Option
Reviews.Author: Kristen Stewart
Reviews.Content: This Dell Inspiron was my first foray into Windows 8, and I think the touchscreen really made the new OS shine. It's easy to use and fairly intuitive, something I can see appealing across generation lines from little kids to seniors.The touchscreen is certainly the most advanced feature this laptop can boast. Overall, this is a budget laptop that does everything an average user needs it to do.It's a large, fairly heavy laptop best suited for a desk. It's not the sort of laptop I imagine people will move from room to room throughout the day, more for someone who wants to have a computer that's portable so they can occasionally bring it with them when they really need to. The screen resolution is fairly low for 2013, but it's really fine for most uses and it has an HDMI out so you can connect it to a larger monitor or your TV easily on occasion. I don't love the textured finish, but that's really an aesthetic choice on my part and nothing that takes away from the functionality of the laptop.For those who aren't ready to go completely to the cloud, or like to watch or burn DVDs, it has a DVD±R Drive. I think this is an important feature in this price range. It does offer both bluetooth and a media card reader in addition to 4 USB drives, which should be enough for any average user.Everything I tested ran fairly fast and generally smoothly. It does not have a lot of pre-loaded software, but users can pick and choose what they really need or use cloud apps, so that isn't a deterrent for me. This is not a great choice for a gamer or graphic designer or a hard core photographer, but otherwise, I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good
Reviews.Author: Michele
Reviews.Content: I swore that in my lifetime, I would never buy a Dell.  So, now I have to eat my words.  I thought maybe I might like this, but so far I am really enjoying it.  It didn't come preloaded with all the trash that it would have in the past.  Windows 8 has a small learning curve, but you will learn it.  Battery life is decent.  Loving the touch screen.  The screen is shiny and you can see finger marks, easy to clean (but not with Windex!)  So far, I am liking this little gem.

Reviews.Title: A miserable experience
Reviews.Author: Grenville Morris "Richard Morris"
Reviews.Content: My old laptop is a 7-year old Dell Inspiron B130. It has the very stable XP operating system, and I love that laptop and I intend to keep it. My wife and I are very old, and because of favorable experience with Apple iPad we were attracted by the the touch screen incorporated into the subject laptop. But it is a miserable experience trying to navigate. Microsoft claims you can seamlessly change between Touch and Mouse. We are not inexperienced users, and dispute that claim. You might start with the Mouse because you can see the pointer when you sign in to your Microsoft account,but then the pointer disappears after you touch the screen. I am very sorry to have bought this product. We hope our experience will improve before we have to try to sell it. We would welcome advice from any reviewer who can help us.12/22/2013 I'm feeling a lot better about Lily, my new laptop. As usual, the problem is me. Since I wrote the above harsh criticism I have calmed down and read the instructions. I am navigating with a compass, with my eyes open, not blind with fury and frustration. I am beginning to feel more confident, and have decided not to sell the new laptop.

Reviews.Title: I finally have a working computer
Reviews.Author: Vermonter
Reviews.Content: I had this unit for about 2 weeks and decided to stream a movie through the HDMI port.  It did not work. Called Dell support and we tried several things for well over an hour.  Dell decided the mother board was bad.  I chose to return it through Amazon for a replacement.I receive unit #2 and it will not boot.  The Dell rep had me do several things including removing and resetting the hard drive.  Finally Dell decided the hard drive was bad.  This time I thought the fastest way was for them to send me a new hard drive.  I put in the new hard drive and it booted and initialized itself.  Right now it is working, but now I need to reload all my software and test it out.  Even if it works I will be nervous about future problems.I will say the Dell support reps were knowledgeable, patient and polite.  5 stars for them.

Reviews.Title: Super fast computer!
Reviews.Author: James D. Ehmann "Jim E."
Reviews.Content: It is very fast (I'm used to my old clunkers running Vista and XP).Starts up and closes down very quickly. I can actually close the lid and it will not shut down on me. It is very light, has many ports.There is no "division" between the keyboard and the number pad, so I find myself looking for keys (editing/numbers/navigation) vs. feeling for them.The touch screen doesn't impress me much, I usually go to the desktop where I am familiar with the environment, I try to use it sometimes just to get familiar with the touch and swipe. Touch screen is cool if you want to impress people.On screen keyboard is nice for times when I'm too lazy to put the laptop in a position so I can use the actual keyboard (for those non-ergonomic times).Finding administrative programs is a little frustrating, you have to search for them, vs. going to a control panel. There are some admin. apps for that appear on the tile page if you allow it (some open up in the 8 version, and some open up in the old style). It does not show all the functions you can perform until you activate the icon/app.When I use a browser on the touch screen (non desk top) side, I can't get used to the navigation. I'm used to having icons, or short cuts to navigate the browser. I just discovered you have to right click to show the other open screens or to add them, I prefer open tabs (this was probably on one of the tutorials, but there was a lot to remember). When you are on the start screen and swipe or scroll to the right and start an app., when you return, you are back to the left of the screen, and have to scroll over again.I prefer the desktop and use Mozilla Nightly browser, which is touch control as well.Over all I like it, I'm just a dinosaur.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT!!!!
Reviews.Author: Erin
Reviews.Content: I'm using it right now! Love the touch screen. Makes it to where you can use it for so much more!

Reviews.Title: love my laptop
Reviews.Author: Zenaida Vargas
Reviews.Content: when I look at the reviews I knew I wanted this touch screen lap top, but then I got reviews that u would have to deal with the finger print both on the outside n screen . that was no problem I had order dust clothe from online after I use my computer I clean it n there is no finger prints on it.the dell support agents. were great , it took less then 10 minutes to show me how to work it. since I have it from the 6 of December 2013 it has work really good  thank you Amazon n Dell.

Reviews.Title: Nice well made computer..
Reviews.Author: wayman simmang
Reviews.Content: Read a lot of reviews. I like everything about this computer. Works fast and had no problems at all with it. Was hesitant about some of the reviews that gave it a poor rating. I give it 5 stars.. Runs fast for a budget computer and everything I need it to do, It does..Windos 8.. Not so thrilled but getting use to it.. :)..

Reviews.Title: As expected.
Reviews.Author: MLN
Reviews.Content: I had no problems adjusting to Windows 8 or the touch screen. I wish they still came loaded with Word.

Reviews.Title: EVERYTHING AND MORE
Reviews.Author: Sydney
Reviews.Content: I ordered this yesterday and I jus now received it today...... I LOVE IT!!! It's great the touch screen is obviously my fav part. Works really well and I'm just ready to use it throughout dental school :)

Reviews.Title: What more can I say,
Reviews.Author: Robert J Mancuso "Bob"
Reviews.Content: Just what I expected and W8 is impressive.  Lap turns on in seconds.  Weight ideal. Screen very good. Recommend puurchase for the price and tech inside the machine.

Reviews.Title: PC
Reviews.Author: Droga
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my parents for Christmas. I like the touchscreen. Have never owned a touchscreen laptop before, this was the first time playing with one. Very cool.The processor is pretty s***e for today's standards, but I bought this for under $450 in the Black Friday sale, so price was great. Also my parents only use it to play solitare and judge me on Facebook, so it's plenty powerful enough to suit their needs.

Reviews.Title: TOUCH SCREEN LAPTOP?...OH YES :-)
Reviews.Author: Bty
Reviews.Content: THIS IS AMAZING, ONLY COMPLAINT.....MIRCOSOFT OFFICE IS ONLY PRELOADED AS 30DAY TRIAL, MAJOR SET BACK , AS THIS IT TO BE SCHOOL COMPUTER, COLLEGE -SINGLE MOM W/AUTISTIC 4 YR OLD

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Deodath Ramheerai
Reviews.Content: Very impressive for its price but screen viewing angles are bad hence its 4 star rating. Usual dell bloatware easy to uninstall

Reviews.Title: a complete disgrace
Reviews.Author: Claire N. Hillenbrand "daisygoogles"
Reviews.Content: This computer is horrible, The screen flashes occasionally Menu Freezes for no reason and funky things starting to happen. had to click on the start menu multiple times to fix it. At first i thought it was a virus, but after a scan the menu still freezes. The only sound plug broke. Do not buy.

Reviews.Title: reasonable price but too big in size
Reviews.Author: snereddy
Reviews.Content: dont consider buying it if you are a student as very heavy and big in size.... but if most of the work is from work....definitely go for it

Reviews.Title: So pleased I chose Dell!
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: This is the 1st laptop I've bought for myself, by myself, and it's rather intimidating with all the different brands/types of laptops. After months of research, I kept coming back to the Dell Inspiron.Let me tell you, I am not disappointed! The price was great, especially being touch screen, Windows 8, plenty of storage with an i3 core. The look and feel is wonderful, comfortable keyboard and spacing.Yes, it leaves finger prints. I'm a bit of a stickler when it comes to finger prints, but I've found that a soft, dry cloth wipes them up good. The screen also shows lots of prints, but if you're used to a smart phone, then you'll get used to the prints on this too. Again, soft, dry cloth cleans it up nicely. I don't know if I want to get a screen protector. I don't want it to mess with the feel of the touch screen.Touch screen is nice and I found it easy to navigate. It's a little touchy, can open apps you don't mean to open, but all trial and error. It glides nicely and has a ton of features and uses, personalize it for what you want, extra storage for what you don't need on your start page.I've downloaded iTunes, more pictures than I care to admit, games, etc and she is still moving quickly and quiet! It's really quiet! Starts up within 2 min. Updates took about 5 min.As a single mom, I needed a reliable and affordable laptop to fit my needs for work, my kids school needs, and of course, all the fun we like to have with it as well. Did I mention it comes with 3 or 4 USB ports, hdmi, and a CD/DVD player? What's not to love?!?! I may not be a tech guru, but I'm no dummy either. This was the next best purchase aside from my divorce! (lol) Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: its what i expected
Reviews.Author: WJ
Reviews.Content: Its a solidly built well performing low end budget laptop.  I like the unpretentious and seemingly rugged construction and texture of the case, but it is a fingerprint magnet.  The whole thing is a fingerprint magnet, from the touch screen to the outside.  Thats my biggest gripe.it is not a high spec laptop, so dont expect high performance.  In its original configuration it is slow, but usable.  I switched out the hard drive for a low end ssd, and doubled the memory.http://amzn.com/B00A1ZTZOGhttp://amzn.com/B008CP5QJKafter these improvements the laptop is very quick to start stop and run, and is fun to use.  it will add about 100 to the price but i feel it performs on a level of much more expensive laptops.  still ended up being a bargain.just fyi,  windows 8/8.1 is a steaming pile of crap, this is not dells fault so it is not reflected in the reviews.  but be warned, its convoluted and un-intuitive.  there are a couple of positives like the search features, but they are only positives because the rest of the operating system is so messed up you need them.  i have put ubuntu (a linux operating system) on it and it worked well with out having to set anything up.  but it does not play well dual booting with windowsin conclusion,great system, despite Microsofts view of the future,  fantastic if your planning on wiping windows and only using linux

Reviews.Title: love my new Dell
Reviews.Author: Mr Allen Kowalkowski
Reviews.Content: All what I expected it to be. I can not wait to learn more about windows eight and I am sure it will work out fine for our needs

Reviews.Title: Second computer
Reviews.Author: Gene Jakubczak
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my wife. It is used as a secondary computer to access the internet, pay bills, etc. Although we are still adapting to Windows 8, computer meets our needs and functions as expected.

Reviews.Title: Dell Inspiron 15 Touchscreen Laptop
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: I love this PC.  Everything is easy to use and simple.  However, it does take a little time to find things if you are used to using the old operating sytem.  Once you figure out the difference, the PC is really easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Good laptop for the price
Reviews.Author: AnSi
Reviews.Content: The main reason I bought this laptop was to gift someone with a touchscreen laptop. The price was the main motivator for the given configuration. I found it easy to use and I generally like the keyboard layout of Dell laptops. The touchscreen is good and really useful with Windows 8. The only reason I am knocking off a star is because of Windows 8 - it's probably one of the worst OSes you could have even after touch screen making some things easy.

Reviews.Title: Delivery was SUPER!  So Far like the computer...
Reviews.Author: ctutor1
Reviews.Content: I like it so far!  Best of all since my old Dell started crashing and I was up for a new one anyway, I hit the order button on this computer and hoped it would work great for our business.  The best of all was it arrived in less then 14 hours!  (without the drone!)  Amazing delivery time!I used Windows and taught classes in windows for 27 years, but have been retired for 9 years.  Had XP for my last computer, and this was a new adventure.  Still trying to do some things the old way, but I love the touch screen, and I've been able to setup my file manager the old way.  So I can find everything!So far so good..  I'll be back to post more in the future..  :)

Reviews.Title: Happy with my order
Reviews.Author: Manish Sharma
Reviews.Content: Laptop with a touch screen is a different experience all together. so convenient to use. Timely delivery and good packaging is cherries on the cake....thanks

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Jesse Warwick
Reviews.Content: Really good for the price. Great for simple tasks. I do notice a slight hiccup sometimes in performance but overall this laptop has met my expectations.The build quality seems nice but the material the case is made out of really shows finger prints. Same with the screen.

Reviews.Title: Decent budget laptop
Reviews.Author: J. Harley
Reviews.Content: I scooped up one of these up during a Black Friday lightning deal.  I like it a lot, but it's definitely a budget laptop.  The build is all plastic and gaps around the edges suggest they are banging these things out at a rabid pace.  When I plug in the AC adapter, I can see the metal of the adapter end through the gap between the outer and inner shell.  The touchscreen works well for the most part, although there were a few occasions where responsiveness was less than optimal and I resorted to the mouse. Touch reponsiveness is not as smooth and fluid as with a tablet, which I find odd.  You would think if they can get touch responsiveness perfect on a wafer thin tablet, it should be a slam dunk on a full-blown PC. The 1366x768 resolution is sufficient but far from pretty. It's strictly a utilitarian resolution. The screen is also a little dim and has less contrast than I prefer.The gesture capable mouse is okay but like the touchscreen, seems to be hit or miss at times. Sometimes I can tap the mousepad to make a selection, other times it won't respond unless I tap it multiple times or just click the mouse button instead of tapping the mousepad. Wifi connects reliably but I haven't tested Bluetooth yet.  The keyboard feels sturdy and I like the key response.  The keyboard also has a full number pad.  Performance is about what you'd expect from a core i3 budget laptop.  While obviously not as snappy or quick as an i7 in morre intense applications, I hardly notice a difference light tasks such as web browsing and office applications, which are the only things most home users do anyhow.  As far as gaming, the casual game crowd, those who primarily play games Candy Crush, Bejeweled, Plants vs Zombies, and Maplestory will be happy.  You definitely shouldn't buy this is you're looking for something to play a game like Call of Duty Ghosts, forget it. The same goes for video editing and rendering.  Light photo editing is possible but if you plan to run a program like Photoshop, I'd definitely recommend bumping the RAM up to 8GB first.  Boot time is about 20-30 seconds, which is a bit slow for Windows 8 but I wonder if it's partially due to the Dell software.  Speaking of software, Dell thankfully didn't overload the PC with bloatware. In fact, the only unwanted programs I uninstalled were trials for Mcafee Internet Security and Office 365.  There are a few Dell specific utility programs for backup, retore and support that I left installed. A word of warning, the Dell software started acting flaky after I upgrading to Windows 8.1.  For example, I had to reinstall the Dell backup application before I was able to burn recovery DVDs.  So, my advice is to burn your recovery DVD's and using Dell's support application to check for updated software before upgrading to Windows 8.1.The Dell 15R is a decent budget laptop.  I am very satisfied with the value I received at the lightning deal price.  At 30% off, I basically paid little more than the cost of a new netbook or Chromebook for this laptop. However, at the normal price of close to $500, I would strongly suggest exploring and considering other options.  With a little searching and patience, you could likely find a better bargain.  For instance, a Lenovo P400 Touch with 6GB RAM, (dual-core) i5 processor with turbo boost and 1600x900 resolution was recently selling for nearly the same price as this Dell. I have to be completely honest and admit that I likely would not have purchased this laptop if not for the lightning deal.  However, for $150 less, I can live without an dual-core i5 CPU, a few extra pixels and 2gb of extra RAM.  So my three star rating is for this PC selling at full price.  For the price I paid, it's four stars easily, but I can't rate based on a sale price that lasted mere seconds.  My star rating is based on other laptops at comparable prices, like the aforementioned Lenovo.

Reviews.Title: Great Touchscreen. Great Computer.
Reviews.Author: Stewart R. Shields
Reviews.Content: Very much recommended for moderate personal and business use.  If you run graphical intensive games or programs, it probably wont have enough juice for you. For me, it's perfect!  I ordered two for my office. One came with a bad touchscreen. Amazon took it right back without any questions and even sent me a new one before I could even get the old one packed up.  Great machine. Excellent service.

Reviews.Title: good buy
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Great computer, for the price.  Perfect for the new college student.  Very easy use, and has great battery life.highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: Didn't work right out of the box
Reviews.Author: Howard Sackaroff
Reviews.Content: This piece of junk didn't work right out of the box and it was a Christmas gift. Thought it might be something I did until I figured out it was simply defective.  I should have been suspicious at the beginning since the cords were not tightly wrapped as they usually are. I suspect they shipped me someone else's return

Reviews.Title: Dude, it's a Dell
Reviews.Author: Fight for the User
Reviews.Content: It's functional.  The case/shell is sturdy and has a bit of heft to it.  It doesn't come with a lot of the bloatware that older Dell models came with.  As a replacement for an older (6+ years) Dell, this computer is significantly faster, not only on startup, but also accessing web content.  Seems like a perfect fit for people who want a basic, semi-intuitive touchscreen laptop that offers slightly more than a basic netbook.Keep in mind, however, that the screen is a fingerprint magnet (the drawback to touchscreens), but is very responsive to user input.  I found myself getting headaches after spending a couple hours using this laptop.  I finally realized that it was the screen brightness - way too bright and contrasty.  Unfortunately, Windows 8 doesn't give you the range of customization that previous version of Windows did (e.g. simple things like adjusting brightness and contrast).  I finally settled on a brightness setting that makes the screen tolerable and doesn't induce headaches after a couple hours of use.

Reviews.Title: shuts down for it self
Reviews.Author: jahvissynaxis
Reviews.Content: It began shutting down spontaneously within the first 3 months. An internal problem with the cooling fan. apparently a known HP laptop glitch

Reviews.Title: School computer
Reviews.Author: DanaK
Reviews.Content: I bought this computer for my son for school. This is his 3rd laptop in as many years.  His other two were from Samsung and Acer.  He still uses the Samsung in his room as an extra laptop, but the Acer is destroyed.My son likes this laptop the best so far.  He uses the touchscreen quite a bit, enjoys the Window 8 platform and likes the screen size.  He has not said there is anything negative at all and is very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Quick delivery, condition as advertised.
Reviews.Author: Bruce Hastie
Reviews.Content: This was an "emergency" replacement for my daughter's school computer.  It is more than adequate for that purpose plus email, internet use etc.  It had to be updated with the most recent Windows release before she could use it, but that had only been out a few months when we bought this.

Reviews.Title: Touch Computer
Reviews.Author: Jerry B
Reviews.Content: I love my computer it has great color, speed and moving from key pad to touch is an awesome experience

Reviews.Title: Nice for grandma :)
Reviews.Author: KatieR
Reviews.Content: I helped my grandmother pick out a computer (she's never had one before) and I decided on this one due to the touchscreen ability, size of the screen, and price.  I went for a touchscreen for her b/c I noticed previously whenever I showed her my computer she'd try and push things on the screen.  Plus I figured trying to teach her how to use a mouse (especially a laptop mouse) might be more trouble than it was worth for what she would be using her computer for.So far so good!  Admittedly since I've never had a touchscreen (except my tablet), this took a bit of trial and error before I was able to teach her how to use it, but now she's mastered getting on and playing solitaire/other games.She's had some trouble getting internet so although I taught her facebook, skype, and the internet, it's still an ongoing process.All in all I think this was the correct purchase for her and for anyone who only plans on using their computer for mainly social purposes.

Reviews.Title: Excelent product
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "AJ"
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with the eprformance of the cmputer and it is very easy to install and operate.  The touchscreen feature works really well..Good product for the family.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: jaaaaado
Reviews.Content: I like the dell touch screen alot.  Windows 8(now updated to 8.1) has been challenging but I'm getting things figured out.  I don't care much for the Microsoft app store.  The laptop itself has worked perfectly for my needs.  For the price I feel there is a lot of value.  If you're new to windows 8 but feel up to the challenge or at least the learning curve, then I would recommend the dell 6144.

Reviews.Title: Okay but has issues
Reviews.Author: Avid Reader Girl
Reviews.Content: I've had two of these in the last 12 hours and am about to return this one and get an entirely different touchscreen laptop as soon as my local Best Buy opens. Here's why-The first one had a dead pixel straight out of the box. Returned it without a problem.The new one locks up about every hour and I can't type, I can't use the screen, I can't do anything. I restart it, I can't get in because I can't type my password. I restart it again, it may or may not work. So I try it again. Sometimes it works. I had to do it five times this morning before I could get in.There is also a design problem that I didn't notice in the store because there I was above it and couldn't feel how it is when I'm using it while sitting down like I would normally have it on my lap. There is a sharp edge around the bottom that has been cutting into my wrist for the three hours I've been on this laptop. Its painful and I'm not dealing with this laptop anymore.

Reviews.Title: GREAT
Reviews.Author: Duch40ene
Reviews.Content: The laptop is working great.  I got it to replace a desktop and it has served me well.  I am no longer tied to the computer room.  I am in the process of learning how to use Windows 8.  All indications are that everything will continue to go well.  The touch screen is a life saver when I am using it in a place that does not lend itself to using the key board.

Reviews.Title: More than what it expected
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "SVD"
Reviews.Content: Bought this during Black Friday sale and It was delivered very quickly.Things I like about it:1. The touch screen, it's so convenient especially when you have a notebook on the keyboard and need to navigate.2. Full numeric key pad, makes it easy for punching numbers especially for a business student like me3. Sky drive, able to store all my information and still access it if something goes wrong with the keypad4. Works with any mouse...5. Start up time, starts up in a flash6. Laptop runs multiple apps at the same time without a hitch and doesn't get hot easily unlike the Lenovo I had before7. Still getting used to using windows 8.1 but it seems easy enough to work with.8. Love the fact that it has a cd/DVD burner and I didn't have to buy one separately9. 500gb of memory isn't bad to start off withThings I dislike1. The left click button has this really loud annoying sound when you click it... I usually avoid using it for that reason2. The matte finish wasn't one of their best design ideas, my hands sweat so you can imagine the number of finger prints on the cover, it looks horrible, and I have to be constantly wiping it down with alcohol .All in all it was a great buy and I'm happy with my new laptop, Dell did good on this one

Reviews.Title: Terrible support, dead after two weeks.
Reviews.Author: SL
Reviews.Content: Bought this laptop as a gift to a friend who lives in Brazil. After two weeks, the LCD was dead and the repair cost would be higher than what I paid for here in USA. Dell has an office in Brazil but said only products sold locally could be repaired under warranty. I will never buy Dell again.

Reviews.Title: Much Needed Upgrade
Reviews.Author: Robert Fogarty
Reviews.Content: Our background.  My wife and I are in our mid-60s.  We're both are very comfortable with just about every feature of 'using the interwebz'.  Neither of us are technophiles by any means nor are we high volume users with huge bandwidth needs.  We do however use our 'net connections' via our phones, our tablet or our computer every hour that we're awake.That being said our main computer for these last 7 yrs was a Dell desktop with Vista installed.  It was really outdated.  We needed a portable device that was more than a just a tablet, I use Excel a lot!  But we didn't need to spend huge dollars to get the latest and fastest.The Inspiron 15 with Win 8 installed fits our needs perfectly.  It's quick to load, easy to navigate and it feels like it will last a good long time.  It feels durable and sturdy.  Using both the tiles and the traditional browser screens is easy to do.  Both have their advantages IMO so I use them both.  I do have a few little annoyances with the 'pop up bars' that suddenly appear if you inadvertently brush your fingers across the touch pad from off the pad to on the pad.I loaded my old copy of Office 2007, Turbo Tax and several other programs from the web.  Each was easy and smooth to install and start up.  So in terms of utility the Inspiron 15 fits the bill perfectly.  Then to top it off the price @ <$400 was just about all that we wanted to pay.  I tend to keep devices well past their 'out-of-date' date.  I think this will suit me fine.

Reviews.Title: Great everyday laptop for the money
Reviews.Author: bs1978
Reviews.Content: .Love this Laptop! High Quality and Easy to Use...Nicely done ...Touch-screen, Easily Upgradeable, Looks Good, Feels Solid..Great Budget Option ..Overall, I think this laptop is a great value for the money and good for everyday computing needs. I've been happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Fingerprints everywhere!
Reviews.Author: F.R.R
Reviews.Content: I love this model, and its very well made, its powerfull and very fast, im also surprised that it ran Starcraft 2 with the integrated intel graphics at medium quality settings. In my opinion, it only had onw downside. Fingerprints and sweat are very noticeable on the touchpad and every section with textured finish (altough looks amazingly professional and expensive when clean).

Reviews.Title: The Dell Laptop is of superior quality, but >>>
Reviews.Author: Edward P Gibson
Reviews.Content: the fact it came installed with Windows 8, which required an 'update' to 8.1 from Microsoft, has been difficult at best.  Windows 8.1 is not user friendly, and version 8 has no START button though a pseudo START button was added in version 8.1.  I have no doubt that Windows 8.1 would be a great platform for a tablet but it is a cultural shift on a laptop or desktop when serious computing is required.  As for the Dell case, it is well built and the outside of the case looks 'tough' but after a few uses it becomes a fingerprint haven.

Reviews.Title: for my son
Reviews.Author: Lori
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my son and he loves it! I would recommend this lap top it has worked great for my son..

Reviews.Title: Love Love Love
Reviews.Author: DeNece
Reviews.Content: I love my new Dell Inspiron!  I would highly recommend it to anyone wanting something new with all the bells and whistles.  The touch screen took a little getting used to since I'm old school but now I love it and so does my family.  This computer came with Dell apps to show you how to get started and was very easy to get around in once I read up on it a little bit.  It's a fun, very useful device for all my families needs - Internet, games, apps of all kinds.  Love it.

Reviews.Title: Everything i expected an then some
Reviews.Author: Billionaire
Reviews.Content: I do not have a single gripe about this laptop! Battery life is superb, the touch is very sensitive. this laptop makes me wonder how people manage to use windows 8 without a touchscreen, boots pretty fast too.

Reviews.Title: Solid purchase!
Reviews.Author: Diane K. Scott
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my partner, who had been using a mini-netbook for about 4 years. Not sure how she did it (lot's of patience, I suppose). She loves how fast the new laptop is, and amazing the video is. It was a smart move on my part, I'm happy to say.

Reviews.Title: Terribly Fingerprint Prone
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased a Dell Inspiron 15 with black matte casing, i3 processor, 4GB mem, 500 GB Storage.Hate the fact that slightest touch of case or keyboard leaves nasty looking fingerprints and smudges even after thorough handwash.Find no better performance than previous laptop with 1 GB mem .  Not a happy camper.Did not purchase through Amazon, but directly from Dell.

Reviews.Title: Vague setup instructions
Reviews.Author: Richard Brunelle
Reviews.Content: Very difficult to setup email account, spent several hours with Dell support and still not working properly. I'm a long time Dell owner and some what tech savvy and can follow instructions but this isn't user friendly.

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: Donna
Reviews.Content: This laptop meets my expectation for mid priced laptop.  Works well on my network.  Not super fast but the speed is acceptable on my network. I have AT&T; Fast Access 6.0.

Reviews.Title: Good computer
Reviews.Author: John Nelson
Reviews.Content: I like it.  Some of the reviews on this were not clear if it is a good computer or not.  So far its good for me.  Win8 is taking some getting used too.  This one is fast.  Screen is nice size and perfect color.  Really like the touchscreen.  More of a "cool" factor than use, but still neat.  Overall, this is a solid computer so far.  Day one.  Hahaha!  Especially for the price!

Reviews.Title: Computer works great
Reviews.Author: Bradley Holmstrom
Reviews.Content: As for the computer it runs just fine, but for the software windows 8 is not so user friendly maybe microsoft released too early. A word of advice check into reviews on the software before purchasing, I did not do that i guess you live and learn

Reviews.Title: GOOOOOOOD
Reviews.Author: Daniel Vega
Reviews.Content: very good computer, with powerfull processor and a lot of thinks, is very thin and very useful for work, thanks

Reviews.Title: Great laptop!
Reviews.Author: Kristina Ward
Reviews.Content: I got this laptop at a great price! Perfect for me! The weight is great and I love the touch screen.

Reviews.Title: It's a great computer for normal activities
Reviews.Author: Daniel Vinicio Ramos Boone
Reviews.Content: This computer looks nice, the touchscreen is very impresionant and responsive, this is a gift for my mom who doesn't require a computer with a lot of specifications. In other words, this computer is able to web surfing, email, music, photos, videos, work with office files, etc. Windows is a very limited software, I think that is the only cons, but overall it's the best computer that you can buy comparing with others of the same specifications.The only thing I desagree, is that Amazon doesn't give a great discount in black friday nor in cyber monday for this computer and four days from cyber monday, the price of the computer drops to $399, I think you should put the best offers in the days I already told and not in the days after, or in the next time on these dates I will wait for better discounts in the following days.

Reviews.Title: network problems
Reviews.Author: William Barwick
Reviews.Content: I've the computer over a month still not able to connect to internetnew wireless modem new cable modem I've had a comp tech tryto fix it might be more of a win 8 issue or the network card is bad

Reviews.Title: Awesome all around computer
Reviews.Author: sackingsfan
Reviews.Content: I just need a laptop for school.  I REALLY like this one.  The touch screen features (which I thought I wouldn't use) are great with the layout for windows 8.  The keyboard is nice and quiet.  The speakers for laptop speakers are not too shabby either.  They can get quite loud.  I am able to run games on here if I want, mostly League of Legends.  It was a great price point and had all the features I needed and then some!

Reviews.Title: Hmmm... 4 stars seems fair and this truly is a nice notebook!
Reviews.Author: Matthew J. Hunt
Reviews.Content: So, I'm a techie and I own a small company that, for simplification, is a VAR and Systems Integrator. I'm also a Microsoft Partner, so I wasn't nearly as weirded out about Windows 8 as other users and reviewers. However, I had a Dell Inspiron that I spec'd out myself and purchased before working on a Presidential Campaign during the 2008 cycle that needed to be replaced. That older notebook was Windows 7 Professional and it had been a work horse for sooooo long, that I *hated* the idea of changing horses.My first impressions of this notebook are "good" and I feel that it was made well and the features, as promised, meet the expectations. The touchscreen is VERY responsive and works well. The display is bright and crisp... and the resolution is as expected. I AM NOT a big fan of the keyboard, but my muscle-memory for typing will change and I'll get more proficient. (I can say that a ton of vendors have gone to / reverted to this "chicklet" style of keyboard and it takes quite a while to get up to speed with them if you are used to a more traditional spacing and layout.)The system installed RAM is adequate at 4GB, but if you do development in Visual Studio or GameMaker or anything like that, plan on upgrading AT LEAST to 8GB. I've verified with other owners that this machine does take up to 16GB RAM when using 2 8GB DDR3L modules. I have ordered the upgrades and will update this post when I do so.One thing to consider is that the hard drive is a 500GB 5400 RPM drive... I will need to upgrade this to 1TB and will also report back on any performance gain acquired by going to 7200 RPM.On another note, I can't stress how relieved I am that the touchpad is not quirky nor error-prone like the ones on similarly priced notebooks from Toshiba or HP. I've already worked on these brands for clients and I can tell you that in Windows 8, having a crappy touchpad really, really screws you. This machine exhibits NONE of that behavior and the touchpad is luckily reliable and responsive!So far, this machine has taken everything I've thrown at it and with a few typical tweaks, I'll be a totally happy camper.

Reviews.Title: It's OK
Reviews.Author: wrb
Reviews.Content: I don't have any real complaints  I don't like windows 8, but that's not the computer's faultI think it was probably obsolete when I bought it, but it had a dvd drive which I wanted and a touch screen.I think the touch pad leaves something to be desired, but it mostly works OK.  The  comparative price was reasonable...  I don't think the display is the best ever, but it's OKThe thing is OK ... I'd probably buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Very nice computer for Price
Reviews.Author: Hixie Cruz
Reviews.Content: I received my computer ultra fast. I love it. For the price its ultra light weight and easy to use and speedy. I especially like the touch screen option.

Reviews.Title: Great.
Reviews.Author: Deborah Merritt
Reviews.Content: Great computer. So far so good. Christmas gift for my grandson. He is pleased. Great product for the price. Grandson is pleased.

Reviews.Title: I guess
Reviews.Author: Avontes Monroe
Reviews.Content: I gave this item as a gift to a niece that recently graduated from nursing school.  She Loves it but she should I

Reviews.Title: ROBERT BACH
Reviews.Author: robert bach
Reviews.Content: I LIKE THE TOUCH SCEEN BUT I FIND IT A LITTLE HARD TO MANEUVER AROUND LIKE WHEN I TOUCH THE TABS I HAVE TO HIT IT TWICE LIKE NOW WHEN I TOUCH THE SCREEN IT DOESNT WORK LIKE IM TRYING TO TOUCH TH SUBMIT BUTTON AND ITS NOT WORKING

Reviews.Title: Works For Me!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Just what I needed. Great system for touchscreen. Easy startup. Easy to learn the interface. Windows 8 not cool unless you can use a touchscreen for sure.

Reviews.Title: amazon is the best!
Reviews.Author: JAMES RODGERS
Reviews.Content: Well this is a gift for someone for christmas but it arrived a day early neatly packaged! I'm sure she will love it we always purchase dell products!

Reviews.Title: If you are not used to the touch screen it is different
Reviews.Author: Randy Knopp
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this and I have only had it a short time. I am finding that the touch screen could be something that some people would find difficult to use if they have never used one. I think it a small instruction manual was included it could help others learn how to use this. It could help those who are new to this type of computing.

Reviews.Title: always a hit
Reviews.Author: Elaine Bennington
Reviews.Content: great touch screen, keyboard totally quiet, very fast and high quality as expected in Dell.  best laptop on the market

Reviews.Title: Defective
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey D. Harlan
Reviews.Content: Bad Pixel Right out of the box.  It's a shame because the touch screen was very responsive and the case was sleek and beautiful.  I tried to do a product replacement and the "seller" didn't have any product to offer.  Printed a return label and now I see they do have it, but a weekend went by and now it couldn't be here on time for Christmas.  I don't have an extra $467 laying around to repurchase it either.  Frustrating!

Reviews.Title: Touch Screen Laptop
Reviews.Author: Saravanan
Reviews.Content: I love it. 1st time I am using touch screen laptop, omg..its awesome. I bought it for $399-good deal. I would recommend anyone to buy this laptop.

Reviews.Title: screen lined within 1 week!
Reviews.Author: John V. Dalusio "Audiophile"
Reviews.Content: Screen developed horizontal line within 1 week of purchase.  Windows 8 is a disaster, going to hold off replacing my old laptop for now

Reviews.Title: Love this computer!
Reviews.Author: RetiredMsSarge
Reviews.Content: Thought the Windows 8 would be impossible to learn based on other reviews I've read but surprisingly I picked it up quite fast... I am a 'mouse user' so I continue that way and use the touch screen feature only when necessary but this 15 inch computer is fast fast fast and the graphics are excellent... I am so happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Need Help with Windows 8
Reviews.Author: N. Sim "NJS"
Reviews.Content: So far I am having fun learning about the Windows 8 format.  But it is so different from my desktop (Vista) I am having difficulty finding "help".  Guess I'll get my granddaughter to help me.

Reviews.Title: Price greatly reduced before I even recieved my original order
Reviews.Author: Wendy Ibberson
Reviews.Content: Not happy that I purchased this laptop 9 days ago for $478 and see that the price has now been reduced to $399.  There should be some window of time that if the product price is reduced, the consumer is refunded the difference.  This is a Christmas gift for my daughter, so I hope it fulfills her needs.

Reviews.Title: Extremely disappointed
Reviews.Author: Syuen Ferreira
Reviews.Content: I only got the computer one week and the touch screen stop working and it keep shutting down and restarting. I am extremely upset because I was looking forward to a good PC. Now I'm stuck between a rock and a hard place because I have so much work backed up I can't afford to send it back :(

Reviews.Title: DELL Inspiron BAD tech support
Reviews.Author: tom41
Reviews.Content: OK, so I bought two of these laptops,  both had problems.The WIFI would not connect on one , called Dell tech support, well Tech support was a disaster, 2 hours on the phone,yes2 hours! not to mention a major language barrier...so they decided to replace the Wifi card, waited 1 week for a tech to show up...still did not work, another 2 hour phone call and at the end I got dropped,...then anther 2 hour call, finally had to do a complete restart. for now its working,but who knows.I will not buy another DELL...

Reviews.Title: Buyers Beware
Reviews.Author: Pauline Michalk
Reviews.Content: Operating system not stable.I updated to Windows 8.1 and all kinds of malfunctions have happened.  I placed Yahoo as my Home Page and it worked 2 times when connecting to the internet. Now the last page I was looking at before turning off the computer comes up as my Home Page. When touching the STAR for the Favorites Bar I get all the web sites I looked at before turning off the computer.  The touch screen works sometimes but not all the time even when working on the same page.  I don't even use the computer anymore. I am going to try to trade it off for something else or see if the junkyard will take it.

Reviews.Title: Battery
Reviews.Author: JOEL MANCIA
Reviews.Content: can you pls select the model of the battery and charger of this laptop because I don't find it.thanks.JOEL

Reviews.Title: Okay if you like Windows 8
Reviews.Author: Scott Case "Basement Dweller"
Reviews.Content: The computer is fine.  I just don't like Windows 8.  I bought this because I wanted a laptop with a HDMI port.  I normally use an Apple Macbook Pro, which I love.  I used to work for TSA, and whenever a passenger came through my security line with both an Apple and a PC laptop, I asked them how they liked using them both.  Because they had them both, the Apple was their own and the PC was because it was what they were forced to use for business.  Interesting to watch TV programs, like 24, and you will notice all of the federal computers are Apple.  I keep getting pop-ups when I am trying to accomplish something.  I keep getting windows asking me to download applications, none of which I want.  On a PC, I am used to using Windows XP Pro.

Reviews.Title: It's ok, not great!
Reviews.Author: Angela Sullivan
Reviews.Content: I like my 5 year old Dell much better!  He colors aren't as vivid and have had issues with it already!
